body: just as a quick test- i can reproduce this in an arch linux container too (with curl 8.10 from core-testing), and 8.9 works there too, just to rule out that it's a magic musl libc issue

There are a number of tests of --upload-file - in the test suite (60, 98, 1068,
1069, 1072, 1073) but none with HTTP/2 and none with https. If I switch test
1068 to use https instead, it does, indeed, hang.

Actually, I take that backâ€”I had set up the test incorrectly. Test 1068 modified to upload a file to a https server works just fine, using both OpenSSL and GnuTLS. But, I haven't tried HTTP/2, and I see your update just now points to an HTTP/2 issue.
yeah, --http1.1 fixes it so it's indeed http2 specific and the bisect looks correct

issue.title: upload data from stdin, fix eos forwarding

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
When uploading data from stdin ('-T -'), and the EOS was only detected on a 0-length read, the EOS was not forwarded to the filters. This led HTTP/2 to hang on not forwarding this to the server.

Refs #14870

Added test_07_14 to reproduce and verify.

issue.title: clang 21 reports `-Wuninitialized-const-pointer` in `lib/requests.c`

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

Bumped curl-for-win to use clang 21 (for ARM64), which failed on the first daily build with:
```
/home/runner/work/curl-for-win/curl-for-win/curl/lib/request.c:313:31: 
error: variable 'tmp' is uninitialized when passed as a const pointer argument here
[-Werror,-Wuninitialized-const-pointer]
  313 |     result = xfer_send(data, &tmp, 0, 0, &nwritten);
      |                               ^~~
1 error generated.
```
https://github.com/curl/curl-for-win/actions/runs/17278096610/job/49039893244#step:3:10813

Related commit: 70d3a9b6aa69ffdd9435e168463cfabd21e17cd1 #14877 #14870


### I expected the following

Clean build

### curl/libcurl version

master 3c64ffaff4cd8c8275627dd2e17b6879a1d32262


### operating system

caught with a Windows build, but OS-agnostic
